hackathon-description-text: is one of the greatest social and economic challenges of the 21st century.

hackathon-judges.judge-role: Head of Corporate Research at KUKA Roboter GmbH
Chair of the AAL Advisory Board

hackathon-eligibility: This challenge is open to individuals and teams, over the age of 16 years.
hackathon-rules:
- Teams are groups of up to 6 people. You can come by yourself but the more the merrier! 
- We are an harassment-free event, make sure to follow the

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: The winner of the best hardware solution idea will receive a fast-track selection for the next HighTechXL program in 2017

hackathon-judging-criteria.judging-criterion: The concept should be tailored to one of the persona provided by us at the beginning of the event.

Technology should be internet connected, have in-built data and transmission capability, make notifications or exchange information and demonstrate the potential to work with a variety of other products.

Demonstrate how the concept will effectively meet older people’s aspirations. The concept should show that end users would be able to adopt it on a daily basis, even without high levels of digital literacy.

Demonstrate a new or adaptive way of solving a problem or introducing a completely new approach to solving the problem. Or significantly different from solutions already available. New, aspirational, exciting, but practical.
a working example of the idea or demonstrate the ability to develop one, would be a great bonus!

hackathon-description-header: Empowering Healthy Ageing through Robotics, IoT and A.I.
